header: ORDER BELOW EXH. 4 IN CRI. BAIL APPLICATION No. 159/2019 (Nilesh Bharat Ahivale Vs. State of Maharashtra) CNR : MHST01­000827­2019

background.text: 1) Present application is filed by the applicant Nilesh Bharat Ahivale, apprehending his arrest under C.R. no. 74/2019 registered at Phaltan city police station, at the instance of Arjun Narayan Chavan, for alleged commission of offences punishable under sections 323, 353, 504 & 506 of Indian Penal Code, 1860 and hence has approached Court seeking pre­arrest bail.

legalActFound.stringMatched: under sections 323, 353, 504 & 506 of indian penal code

arguments.text: 2) Alongwith said pre­arrest bail application, the applicant has also preferred ad­interim pre­arrest bail application at Exh. 4.

argumentSentences.text: 2) Alongwith said pre­arrest bail application, the applicant has also preferred ad­interim pre­arrest bail application at Exh. 4.

arguments.text: 3) Advocate for applicant argued that, false FIR is filed against the applicant. No incident had taken place as alleged. It is further contended that, as on date the applicants are in no arrears of any amount, therefore, there would not arise any circumstances for lodging of FIR. Hence, applicant is require to be protected atleast till filing say by APP/IO. Accordingly, prayed for interim pre­arrest bail. 4) Upon perusing FIR, hearing advocate for applicant, it appears that, applicant for the time being can be provided interim pre­arrest bail atleast till filing of say by AP.P./IO. Accordingly, I proceed to pass the following order.

argumentSentences.text: 3) Advocate for applicant argued that, false FIR is filed against the applicant.
No incident had taken place as alleged.
It is further contended that, as on date the applicants are in no arrears of any amount, therefore, there would not arise any circumstances for lodging of FIR.
Hence, applicant is require to be protected atleast till filing say by APP/IO.
Accordingly, prayed for interim pre­arrest bail.
4) Upon perusing FIR, hearing advocate for applicant, it appears that, applicant for the time being can be provided interim pre­arrest bail atleast till filing of say by AP.P.
Accordingly, I proceed to pass the following order.

order.text: ORDER 1) Application Exh. 4 is granted. 2) In the event of arrest of applicant Nilesh Bharat Ahivale, he be released on interim pre­arrest bail under C.R. no. 74/2019, registered at Phaltan city police station, on his furnishing P.B. & S.B. of Rs. 15,000/­ (Rs. Fifteen Thousand), till filing of say by prosecution/I.O. on following terms & conditions : a) Applicant shall attend the concern police station twice in a week preferably on every Tuesday and Friday in between 11:00 a.m. to 2.00 p.m. b) Applicant shall not directly or indirectly make any inducement, threat or promise to any person acquainted with the facts of the case so as to dissuade them from disclosing such facts to the court or to any Police Officer. c) Applicant shall make available himself and co­operate for interrogation by Police Officer as and when required and shall co­operate in the investigation of the present C.R. d) Applicant shall not tamper any of the documents connected to the present C.R. under investigation. e) Applicant shall also produce the documents called by the I.O. during the course of his investigation. f) Issue notice to Public Prosecutor as to why interim pre­arrest bail granted to the applicant shall not be confirmed. Notice r/o. 11th March, 2019.

footer: (Y. H. Ameta) Place : Satara Addl. Sessions Judge Date : 02nd March, 2019. Satara
processedText:
ORDER BELOW EXH. 4 IN CRI. BAIL APPLICATION No. 159/2019 (Nilesh Bharat Ahivale Vs. State of Maharashtra) CNR : MHST01­000827­2019 
---header-ends---
1) Present application is filed by the applicant Nilesh Bharat Ahivale, apprehending his arrest under C.R. no. 74/2019 registered at Phaltan city police station, at the instance of Arjun Narayan Chavan, for alleged commission of offences punishable under sections 323, 353, 504 & 506 of Indian Penal Code, 1860 and hence has approached Court seeking pre­arrest bail. 
---background-ends---
2) Alongwith said pre­arrest bail application, the applicant has also preferred ad­interim pre­arrest bail application at Exh. 4. 
---argument-ends---
3) Advocate for applicant argued that, false FIR is filed against the applicant. No incident had taken place as alleged. It is further contended that, as on date the applicants are in no arrears of any amount, therefore, there would not arise any circumstances for lodging of FIR. Hence, applicant is require to be protected atleast till filing say by APP/IO. Accordingly, prayed for interim pre­arrest bail. 4) Upon perusing FIR, hearing advocate for applicant, it appears that, applicant for the time being can be provided interim pre­arrest bail atleast till filing of say by AP.P./IO. Accordingly, I proceed to pass the following order. 
---argument-ends---
ORDER 1) Application Exh. 4 is granted. 2) In the event of arrest of applicant Nilesh Bharat Ahivale, he be released on interim pre­arrest bail under C.R. no. 74/2019, registered at Phaltan city police station, on his furnishing P.B. & S.B. of Rs. 15,000/­ (Rs. Fifteen Thousand), till filing of say by prosecution/I.O. on following terms & conditions : a) Applicant shall attend the concern police station twice in a week preferably on every Tuesday and Friday in between 11:00 a.m. to 2.00 p.m. b) Applicant shall not directly or indirectly make any inducement, threat or promise to any person acquainted with the facts of the case so as to dissuade them from disclosing such facts to the court or to any Police Officer. c) Applicant shall make available himself and co­operate for interrogation by Police Officer as and when required and shall co­operate in the investigation of the present C.R. d) Applicant shall not tamper any of the documents connected to the present C.R. under investigation. e) Applicant shall also produce the documents called by the I.O. during the course of his investigation. f) Issue notice to Public Prosecutor as to why interim pre­arrest bail granted to the applicant shall not be confirmed. Notice r/o. 11th March, 2019. 
---order-ends---
(Y. H. Ameta) Place : Satara Addl. Sessions Judge Date : 02nd March, 2019. Satara
